name: Ms. Angela's Smothered Cabbage
author: MadelynDub
summary: My best friend and I make this every year on New Year's Day, and it's so delicious! We always serve it with homemade cornbread, black eyed peas, Champagne, and ham. Happy New Year, everyone!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon Creole seasoning (such as Tony Cachere's®)
½ (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®), or more to taste
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat
Add onion, green pepper, and garlic
Cook and stir until browned, about 5 minutes
Add pork, Creole seasoning, and salt
Cook until pork is browned, 5 to 7 minutes
Arrange cabbage over pork; cover with diced tomatoes
Add lid and reduce heat to medium
Cook, without stirring, until cabbage is wilted, 15 to 20 minutes
